abstract: Oakland Raiders coach Hue Jackson trades two high draft picks to Cincinnati Bengals to acquire quarterback Carson Palmer to replace injured Jason Campbell; move indicates that Jackson has stepped into void left by death of longtime Raiders owner Al Davis, and become one of football's most powerful coaches.
snippet: The trade that stunned the N.F.L. was a clear recognition that Hue Jackson, in his first year as a head coach on any level, had suddenly become one of the most powerful coaches in the game.
lead_paragraph: The trade that stunned the N.F.L. was a clear recognition that Hue Jackson, in his first year as a head coach on any level, had suddenly become one of the most powerful coaches in the game.

headline.main: Stepping Into Raiders’ Void, a Coach Makes a Bold Deal
headline.print_headline: A Coach Steps Into the Raiders’ Void
headline.seo: Free From Al Davis’s Grasp, Hue Jackson Makes Bold Move for Raiders
